content: At Open Health, we prioritize the privacy and security of our users and their data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect personal and health-related information. By using our platform, you agree to the terms outlined in this policy.

subSections.title: 1.1 Personal Information
list: Name, surname, and contact details (email, phone number)
Identification numbers (where applicable)
Professional credentials (for healthcare providers)

subSections.title: 1.2 Health Information
list: Patient demographics
Medical history, diagnoses, treatment plans, and prescriptions
Laboratory test results
Appointment and consultation records

subSections.title: 1.3 System and Usage Data
list: Login details and authentication logs
IP address and device information
User interactions with the platform for security and analytics

subSections.title: 1.4 Payment Information
list: Billing details (for institutions using paid services)
Transaction history
Provide healthcare management services
Ensure compliance with medical regulations
Improve platform functionality and user experience
Communicate with users about system updates, security alerts, and support requests
Prevent fraud, unauthorised access, and security breaches
Encryption: Protecting data in transit and at rest
Access Control: Restricting access to authorized personnel only
Audit Logs: Tracking user activities for compliance and security
Regular Security Assessments: Identifying and mitigating risks
content: Despite these efforts, no system is completely secure. Users are responsible for safeguarding their login credentials.

list: With Authorized Healthcare Providers: To facilitate patient care and record-keeping
With Third-Party Service Providers: For cloud storage, payment processing, and technical support (subject to strict confidentiality agreements)
As Required by Law: To comply with legal obligations, court orders, or government regulations
In Case of Business Transfers: If Open Health is acquired or merged, data may be transferred under similar privacy safeguards
Comply with legal and medical record-keeping requirements
Provide ongoing healthcare services
Resolve disputes and enforce agreements
content: Users may request data deletion, subject to compliance with healthcare laws.

list: Access Personal Data: Request a copy of stored personal information
Correct Data: Update or rectify inaccuracies
Withdraw Consent: Opt out of marketing communications
Request Deletion: Request removal of personal data (subject to legal requirements)
content: To exercise these rights, contact us at info@openhealth.co.za

list: Protection of Personal Information Act (POPIA)
National Health Act
Health Professions Council of South Africa (HPCSA) Regulations
content: Users must also ensure compliance with applicable medical data protection laws.
If Open Health stores or processes data outside South Africa, we ensure compliance with data protection laws and secure transfer mechanisms.
We may use cookies to enhance user experience and gather analytics. Users can manage cookie preferences through browser settings.
We may update this policy periodically. Users will be notified of significant changes, and continued use of Open Health constitutes acceptance of the revised policy.
For privacy-related inquiries, contact us at: Email: info@openhealth.co.za
